events.event_description: U.S. retail gasoline prices reached their highest point of 2024 at $3.67/gal in late April, before the summer driving season.
events.citation: The retail gasoline price was highest in 2024 during late April when it reached $3.67/gal

events.event_description: U.S. retail gasoline prices hit their annual low of $3.01/gal in early December 2024.
events.citation: Retail gasoline prices decreased to an annual low of $3.01/gal in early December and remained at a similar level through the rest of 2024.

events.event_description: Weaker summer gasoline demand in 2024 compared to 2023 led to inventory buildup across the United States.
events.citation: Weaker U.S. gasoline demand during the summer of 2024 than in 2023 helped to build inventories throughout much of the United States.

events.event_description: The Rocky Mountains region experienced the largest decrease in gasoline prices among all U.S. regions, dropping $0.42/gal compared to 2023.
events.citation: U.S. gasoline prices were lower on average in 2024 than in 2023 in all regions, with the largest decrease in the Rocky Mountains, where prices were $0.42/gal lower.

events.event_description: U.S. gasoline prices fell to their lowest levels since 2020 by Thanksgiving 2024.
events.citation: prices were lower at the end of summer, ahead of Labor Day, and fell to their lowest since 2020 by Thanksgiving.
